wikipedia_page.main: Tommy Randall (25 March 1885 – 17 November 1946) was an English footballer who played as a defender for West Ham United.

link_mentions.page: List of West Ham United F.C. players

response: Despite his disciplinary problems Piercy became the first West Ham United player to play 200 games when he appeared on 17 April 1911 against Southampton. Tommy Randall replaced Piercy as captain for the 1911–12 season and on 20 January 1912 Piercy was injured against Plymouth Argyle in what turned out to be his final game for West Ham. After playing 214 games he retired from playing and was appointed assistant trainer under Charlie Paynter with responsibility for the reserve team.
